Interactive: Design Thinking (Course objective 4)

Interview a person who works in a problem solving field.  You will be asking them about the design thinking process:  empathize > define > ideate > prototype > test.

  Ask the following questions plus four (4) questions of your own:

  1. What role does design thinking play in your job or field? 
  2. What are challenging aspects of your job? 
  3. What are your favorite parts of your job? 
  4. What would you recommend, in relation to design thinking, to someone going into this field?  

Include the name, position, and employer of the person you interviewed.

Submit each question followed by its answer--total of 8 questions and answers. 

See assignment expectations

Submit

Interactive: Space Shuttle Challenger (Course objective 3)

Ethics are always at play.  The Space Shuttle Challenger tragedy has some interesting ethical dilemmas we can learn from.  Read the following handout Space Shuttle Wikipedia page, prepare a short lecture/speech (at least 3 minutes no more than 5 minutes long) answering the following questions:

  1. What could NASA have done differently?
  2. What should Roger Boisjoly have done differently (if anything)? In answering this question, keep in mind that at his age, the prospect of finding a new job if he was fired was slim. He also had a family to support.
  3. What do you (the students) see as your future engineering professional responsibilities in relation to both being loyal to management and protecting the public welfare?

Once completed upload your video to YouTube, Vimeo, etc. and provide the URL.  You must be in the video giving the speech/lecture.

See also assignment expectations.

There is some belief that in the near future bio-engineered body parts will be commonplace. 

  • What are your thoughts and why?
  • How might social, ethical or legal concerns play a part?

Next, comment on the post of a minimum of one other student in a thoughtful and academic way that enhances the conversation. See rubric for grading and assessment measures.    

See posting to discussions

See assignment expectations

description:

Interactive: Six Sigma and Lean (Course objective 1)

Make your original post by Thursday and follow up comments by Sunday.

Make an original substantive post on the following topic:

What are the similarities and differences between Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma. Do research on work situations in which one methodology is more appropriate than the other. You can also debate the pros and cons of each method. 

Research a bit on the topic and share your thoughts.

Next, comment on the post(s) of a minimum of one other student in a thoughtful and academic way that enhances the conversation.  See rubric for grading and assessment measures.

assignment_name: Interactive: Interview Business Intelligence or Analytics (Course objective 3)
description:
Submit

Interactive: Interview Business Intelligence or Analytics (Course objective 3)

Interview a person who works in a business intelligence or analytics field.  Ask the following questions plus four (4) questions of your own: 

  1. What role does your job play in business decision making and management? 
  2. What are challenging aspects of your job? 
  3. What are your favorite parts of your job? 
  4. What would you recommend to someone going into this field?  

Include the name, position, and employer of the person you interviewed.

Submit each question followed by its answer--total of 8 questions and answers.

See assignment expectations

Submit

Interactive: Artificial Intelligence Video (Course objective 2)

Create a short two (2) minute video that explains what artificial intelligence is and how it is applied in a practical sense to individual careers, materials, and/or products (using the book and other sources to find information). You must be visible at some time in the video to receive points.

Next, post it on YouTube, Vimeo, or some other location and provide an accessible link.  

You must create your own original content; Simply using video content created by another person will not be accepted, although you can use other videos and web sites for research and inspiration.  Reference your sources at the end of the video clip. 

See assignment expectations

assignment_name: Graphical: Winter ready dog door (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Graphical: Winter ready dog door (Course objective 2)

Its time to put on your design thinking cap and define, ideate, and prototype! Here is the situation: Winters can be very cold based on where you live. Dog owners who live in these cold parts have been stuck with drafty and thin dog doors. You have been asked to find a potential solution for this problem. However, the solution cannot cost more than $100 per door and must function for dogs up to 60 pounds. They must be able go in and out with ease on their own when the owner is not present. It has to function better than simply putting a blanket or something similar over the dog door flap or having a thinly insulated flap itself.  Be original; that is what design thinking is largely about - finding new solutions.  Sketch your solution as professionally as possible and offer detail for your instructor to be clear on how it would function.  

Remember, this is worth 20 points, subsequently it needs a good amount of effort, thought, and clarity.  

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Consequence Reasoning (Course objective 3)

The book discusses machine intelligence and smart systems.  One aspect of this is the ability to reason and understand consequences. Now, watch some of the videos at HRI Laboratory (Links to an external site.)Links to an external site., where a robot uses consequence reasoning.  Research social, ethical, or legal issues as this type of technology continues to develop and create a visual communication (conveyance of ideas and information in forms that can be seen such as in a flier or poster or powerpoint presentation) that addresses these concerns.  A minimum of two sources must be cited. You will be graded on the depth, accuracy, and relevance of the content.

assignment_name: Graphical: Rockets of the Future (Course objective 4)
description:
Submit

Graphical: Rockets of the Future (Course objective 4)

The last portion of the section "Rockets and Satellites" discusses the future of the spacecraft industry.  Building upon that discussion draw a design for a future rocket manned mission to Mars and reference specific components along with the technology used.  Include a 200 word write up which discusses how other fields of technology will need to be utilized to help this mission be successful.

See assignment expectations

assignment_name: Graphical: Brochure for Location Tracking (Course objective 4)
description:
Submit

Graphical: Brochure for Location Tracking (Course objective 4)

Create a brochure draft that explains how location tracking works in some specific industry that could be distributed at a local high school geographic information systems (GIS) day event  (learn more about GIS day at the GIS Day web site.) 

You will be assessed on the quality, accuracy, relevance and depth of your information and sources.

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Internet of Things (Course objective 3)

Imagine the role you see the Internet of Things (IoT), as described in the course textbook, playing in the next ten to twenty years. Create a poster, collage, or diagram showing the role you predict it to have in the future with brief explanations.  You will be assessed on the quality, thoughtfulness, and professionalism of your work.

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Network Protocol Diagram (Course objective 2)

The book introduces network protocol standards.  Research either TCP/IP or OSI and create a diagram or poster that explains what it is using layers of a cake or some other culinary item as the model.  You will be assessed on the accuracy, quality, professionalism, and depth of your work. 

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Virtual Reality Room (Course objective 2)

You work for an earthquake damage assessment and repair company that deals primarily with buildings, bridges, and infrastructure.  Your company decides it would like to create a virtual reality room where employees and customers can have an immersive experience intended to simulate what it might be like to experience an actual seismic event.  

Based on what you have learned from the textbook, diagram and explain what you would recommend. Next, explain some of the science and technology principles necessary for this to succeed. 

See assignment expectations

assignment_name: Graphical: Semi-autonomous Gun Rules (Course objective 3) WEDNESDAY END
description:
Submit

Graphical: Semi-autonomous Gun Rules (Course objective 3) THURSDAY END

Based on the textbook chapter for this module and considering, in particular, the segment on international defense, you have been asked to recommend rules and regulations for the use of semi-autonomous (semi-autonomous is different than semi-automatic) guns in the United States for civilian and well as governmental use.  What would you recommend and why? Create a visual communication (conveyance of ideas and information in forms that can be seen) that addresses these concerns (200 word minimum).

Important note: If you do semi-automatic instead of semi-autonomous you will get zero points for the assignment

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Blender (Course objective 3)

Graphical: Blender (Course objective 3)
The chapter discusses computer-aided design and its role in manufacturing; In some ways it is changing how we communicate about our needs or expectations. Modeling and prototyping is becoming increasingly important.  Blender is a free 3D modeling software that can be used to create a simple 3D object. Obtain this software and make a simple 3D model of a donut or table or some other simple item (it has to be more complex than a sphere or a box).

Video tutorials and other training resources can be found at:

  • Blender.org tutorials
  • Blender Guru tutorials (the one called "Blender Beginner Tutorial - Page 2: Moving, Rotating, Scaling" shows you how to make a donut)
  • OpenSource tutorials

See assignment expectations

assignment_name: Graphical: Photovoltaic Cells Informative Flier (Course objective 4 )
description:
Submit

Graphical: Photovoltaic Cells Informative Flier (Course objective 4 )

The chapter on Energy discusses photovoltaic cells.  Create an informative flier that describes how photovoltaic cells work and how they could impact some specific field of your choosing. 

For ideas and help on creating a flier, see these websites:

  • How to Design an Awesome Flyer (Even if You're Not a Designer) (Links to an external site.)Links to an external site.   
  • How to Design Your Own Flyer: Templates and Tips (Links to an external site.)Links to an external site. 

You will be assessed on the depth, accuracy, relevance, and professionalism of your submission.

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Create Visual Diagram (Course objective 1)

Create a visual diagram that expresses the many aspects of biotechnology. In this diagram, express how various aspects of biotechnology develop and inter-relate. 

You will be assessed on the professionalism, depth, accuracy, and detail of your diagram. Remember to cite your sources.

See assignment expectations

assignment_name: Graphical: Peering Inside the Body (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Graphical: Peering Inside the Body (Course objective 2)

You have been asked to modify and improve the “peering inside the body” website found in the Exploratorium Magazine Online. 

What design and content changes would you make? How and why? Create a mock-up of your recommendations with detailed rationale for changes made. 

You will be assessed on the professionalism/quality, accuracy, depth, and relevance of your information.

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Nanotechnology and Sports (Course objective 3)

Nanotechnology is ever more present in athletics.  The use of these engineered pieces of equipment can enhance the athlete's chances of success.  At the same time, it can put other athletes without this technology at a disadvantage.  Decide where you sit on this issue - do you side with using or not using nanotechnology to enhance sporting equipment.  Choose one of the sporting equipment examples from the chapter on Nanotechnology and create an persuasive poster (50 words minimum) that communicates your position.  

You will be assessed on the depth, accuracy, and quality of your work. 

See assignment expectations

Submit

Graphical: Data Mining Plan (Course objective 1)

The chapter discusses the importance of data mining in business intelligence and analytics. Now we should consider what goes into a data mining project plan.  Review the article Data Mining Explained and browse this data mining tutorial. 

Next, create a data mining plan for a company of your choosing based on recommendations from this article and from other sources you find.  Your research and plan must be a minimum of three pages, not including images. 

See paper writing guidelines

See assignment expectations

Submit

Research: Computer/Networking Paper (Course objective 2)

Basic science principles such as the nature of forces, motion, and the flow of matter and energy through systems has an impact on computer/networking technology. Choose an area of interest to you in which science principles impact computer/networking technology and write a three (3) page report using APA writing style and a minimum of three (3) sources. 

See paper writing guidelines

See assignment expectations

assignment_name: Research: How GPS or GIS works (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Research: How GPS or GIS works (Course objective 2)

The course textbook describes global positioning systems and geographic information systems.  Choose one of these two areas to research.

Use the course textbook and two other sources for a total of three (3) references.

Write a three (3) page informative paper using APA writing style on how the technology, or an aspect of the technology, works as it relates to science principles of forces, motion or energy. 

See paper writing guidelines

See assignment expectations

Submit

Research: Technology Management (Course objective 3)

Technology management is concerned with development, planning, implementation, and assessment of technological capabilities within an organization or entity.  A simple way to think of it is management of the use of technology for human advantage.  This course, actually, is offered via the Technology Management department here at UVU. 

How do you see technology management relating to current industry needs and why?  Write a 200 word minimum summary of your thoughts with rationale for your assertions.

Use and include a minimum of two external sources for your assessment. 

See assignment expectations

Submit

Research: IDEO project evaluation (Course objective 3)

RES: IDEO project evaluation (CO 3)

Visit the IDEO web site at https://www.ideo.com/ and locate some of the projects they are working on (a category they call “work”). Find one that looks interesting to you and complete the following:

  • Title of project
  • Short description in your own words (cut and paste is not acceptable)—200 word minimum
  • Your assessment of the social relevance, impact, and value of the project—200 word minimum
  • Your assessment of the ethical or legal considerations for the project - 200 word minimum

See assignment expectations

Submit

Research: NASA Missions (Course objective 1)

Visit the NASA web site (Links to an external site.)  (Links to an external site.)and choose one of the space exploration topics under “missions”.  Choose from any mission on this list (including from the A-Z listing of all missions).  Using the NASA website and any other resources you deem appropriate, complete the following:  

  • Name of mission   
  • Summary of the mission in your own words (cutting and pasting is not acceptable)  -- 200 word minimum   
  • Your assessment on the value and importance of this mission with rationale for your viewpoint  -- 200 word minimum  
  • Your assessment of how this technology inter-relates to technologies used in our every day lives

description:
Submit

Research: Application of Physics (Course objective 2) THURSDAY END

Choose two topic areas covered in "College Physics" and address how they are relevant to the development of autonomous or semi-autonomous technology and include:

  • Overview of the two topic areas you chose (150 word minimum)
  • Summary of how the two topics are relevant to the development of autonomous or semi-autonomous technology (150 word minimum)

Research: Medical Technology (Course objective 1)

Choose a current or upcoming medical technology (currently in development or new within the last 5 years) of interest to you and write a three (3) page informative paper about it. Explain how the technology has developed and where it is now. Use APA format and a minimum of three (3) references with in-text citations.

See paper writing guidelines

See assignment expectations

Submit

Research: Nanotechnology in Defense (Course objective 1)

After reading the section "Uses of Nanotechnology" in the textbook chapter relating to this module, consider nanotechnology use in national defense. Choose one of the following nanotechnology areas in this field and assess the benefits and drawbacks of this particular technology as it relates to national defense: fabrics and materials such as armor or clothing intended to withstand extreme conditions, nano-robotics, nanotechnology in weapons, or nanotechnology in vehicles such as in passenger protection, fuel economy or operations. 

Write a two page assessment of your findings using APA writing style and a minimum of two sources.

See assignment expectations

See paper writing guidelines

assignment_name: Research: Big Data and Health (Course objective 4)
description:
Submit

Research: Big Data and Health (Course objective 4)

Read the article, "Can Web Search Predict Cancer? Promise and Worry of Big Data and Health". 

  • What are your thoughts on big data and health as described in this article? 
  • Do you feel the use of big data in health care is generally positive or negative?

Express your thoughts and opinions both of the article itself and of the topic it addresses.  

Write a two page report using APA writing style and a minimum of two sources.

See assignment expectations

See paper writing guidelines

assignment_name: Research: Six Sigma Green Belt (Course objective 4)
description:
Submit

Research: Six Sigma Green Belt (Course objective 4)

The chapter discusses Six Sigma.  Review the American Society for Quality Six Sigma Green Belt certification  (Links to an external site.)as one example of a certification you could obtain.   If you wish to take an actual practice exam to see what the questions would be like, you can also visit the Certified Six Sigma Green Belt Practice Test.  

  • Do you feel a certification such as this can adequately assess a person’s knowledge and skills? Why or why not?
  • What other methods of assessment might be used?
  • If you were a supervisor, how credible would you see a certification such as this?

Write a two page assessment using APA writing style and a minimum of two sources. 

See assignment expectations

See paper writing guidelines

assignment_name: Research: Google Cardboard and Volvo (Course objective 1)
description:
Submit

Research: Google Cardboard and Volvo (Course objective 1)

Volvo is using Google’s cardboard virtual reality headsets (standard cost of about $15) to advertise their latest cars via what they refer to as the Volvo Reality App. 

What are your thoughts about the inter-relationship of these technologies for marketing purposes? (200 word minimum).

See assignment expectations

Submit

Research: Light Pollution (Course objective 1)

Rising light pollution, caused by artificial lights which raise the night sky luminance, has been increasing globally.  Review one of the following sources that discuss the issue and write a critical assessment of the site: 

  • "What Rising Light Pollution Means for Our Health" 
  • "The New World Atlas of Artificial Night Sky Brightness"  
  • "Night Skies (U.S. National Park Service)"
  • "What Happened to the Night Sky?"  
  • "Central Idaho Dark Sky Reserve"
  • "International Dark-Sky Association" 

Your critical assessment must include the following three parts:

  1. Name of the site you chose to review
  2. Critical assessment of site content as it relates to educating readers about light pollution development, changes, and relationship to our world (250 word minimum),
  3. Critical assessment of the website structure, appearance, and usability (150 word minimum) 

See assignment expectations.

Submit

Research: Genetic Food Modification (Course objective 4)

Write a three (3) page report using APA writing style to explain a specific type of genetic food modification and its effects.  

The course textbook describes biotechnology and genetic food modification. Use the course textbook and a minimum of two (2) other references for a total of three (3) references. 

See paper writing guidelines

See assignment expectations

Submit

Research: Engineering Technologies (Course objective 4)

UVU has seven academic offerings which relate to engineering technologies.

As per the "Degrees and Programs" tab on above link, these include:

  • Electrical Automation and Robotics Technology, A.S.
  • Associate in Pre-Engineering - Biological and Chemical Engineering Emphasis, A.P.E.
  • Electrical Automation and Robotics Technology, A.A.S.
  • Associate in Pre-Engineering - Civil and Mechanical Engineering Emphasis, A.P.E.
  • Pre-Engineering, A.S.
  • Mechatronics Engineering Technology, A.A.S.
  • Associate in Pre-Engineering - Computer and Electrical Engineering Emphasis, A.P.E.

Mission Statement

The Mission of the Engineering Technology Department is to prepare graduates to work in high demand, very technical, vastly diverse, automated industries that provide products and services to keep our state and national economy running. The Pre-Engineering graduates are prepared to go into upper level engineering fields at local universities in the state. The Mechatronics graduates are focused on designing the newest machines and automated systems needed by industry. The Electrical Automation and Robotics Technology graduates keep industry running by fixing, adapting, programming, and maintaining the automated machines and systems used in industry. The hands on/class room/lab learning approach used in the Engineering Technology Department is the best skill learning approach in higher education.

Your task:

Research one of the fields above or the field overall. This might include contacting a professional/faculty in the field, internet research, current events, educational resources, etc. Post a 200 word minimum summary of your findings. Make sure to include your source(s).

See also assignment expectations.

assignment_name: Technology Tip - Create a PDF document (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Technology Tip - Create a PDF document (Course objective 2)

Technology Tip - Creating a PDF document 

5 points

In this assignment you will learn to create a PDF file.  PDFs are a free, standardized way to share digital documents with anyone without worrying about what software they are using.  PDFs are also a great choice for uploading your assignments in Tech 1010 to ensure your instructor can read them.

Instructions:

  1. Open the "Technology Tips - Reference Page" (click this link).
  2. Find the section titled "PDF".
  3. Choose one of the software options (Microsoft Word, Apple Pages, or Google Docs) and follow the steps to create a sample document. 
    Note: You may use any other method that you are aware of for creating a PDF as long as you are able to complete steps 4-6 below.
  4. In your document, type at least your name, today's date, and your instructor's name. 
  5. Follow the instructions to save/export your file as a PDF document.
  6. Upload your PDF document to this assignment in Canvas.

If you have any trouble please double check the instructions on the reference page.  See your instructor if for any reason you are unable to complete this assignment.

assignment_name: Technology Tip - Insert a Photo into a Document (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Technology Tip - Insert a Photo into a Document (Course objective 2)

Technology Tip - Insert a Photo into a Document

5 points

In this assignment you will learn to work with photos inside of documents.  This is an important skill for Tech 1010 as many assignments require you to do something and then upload a photo along with a written description.  The simplest and most professional way to do this is to import or paste your photo into a word processing document where is can be labeled and positioned correctly.

Instructions:

  1. Open the "Technology Tips - Reference Page" (click this link).
  2. Find the section titled "Add a Photo"
  3. Choose one of the software options (Microsoft Word, Apple Pages, or Google Docs) and follow the instructions to import a photo of your choice.
    Note: You may use any other method that you are aware of for adding a photo to a document as long as you are able to complete steps 4-7 below.
  4. Add a label that describes the content of your photo.
  5. At the top of your document, before your photo, type at least your name, today's date, and your instructor's name. 
  6. Export your file as a PDF document.
  7. Upload your document to this assignment in Canvas.

If you have any trouble please double check the instructions on the reference page.  See your instructor if for any reason you are unable to complete this assignment.

assignment_name: Technology Tip - Create a Diagram using Free Software (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Technology Tip - Create a Diagram using Free Software (Course objective 2)

Technology Tip - Create a Diagram using Free Software

5 points

In this assignment you will learn to create a professional looking diagram using free software.  This is an important skill for Tech 1010 as many assignments require you to create a diagram.  The simplest and most professional way to do this is with a tool such as LucidChart.  LucidChart is free for UVU students and employees.  

Instructions:

  1. Open the "Technology Tips - Reference Page" (click this link).
  2. Find the section titled "Create a Diagram".
  3. Follow the instructions for gaining access to LucidChart's free software.
    Note: You may use any other software that you are aware of for creating a diagram as long as you are able to complete steps 4-6 below.
  4. Using the instructions given in the Technology Tips reference page, create an organizational diagram with the following six elements each represented as appropriately labeled boxes connected by lines:  CEO, Manager, Engineer, Technician, Administrative Assistant, Student Intern.  Use your own judgement to connect the boxes in a sensible way.
  5. Add a title:  My Tech Company
  6. Save your document at a PDF file and upload it here for credit.

assignment_name: Technology Tip - Sharing a File for Collaboration (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Technology Tip - Sharing a File for Collaboration (Course objective 2)

Technology Tip - Sharing a File for Collaboration

5 points

In this assignment you will learn how to share a file for collaboration.  Sometimes, in a class you may need to work in groups or work collaboratively on the creation of a document.  Web services often referred to as "Cloud Computing" platforms such as Google Drive or Apple iCloud allow you to work on the same documents and save your work where all your group can see the changes.  In this assignment you will learn how to do this.

Instructions:

  1. Open the "Technology Tips - Reference Page" (click this link).
  2. Find the section titled "Sharing a File (Collaboration)".
  3. Follow the instructions for gaining access to Google Drive.
  4. Create a Google Doc document and type into it:  your name, the date, your instuctor's name
  5. Then type into the document the question "Can you see and edit this file?"
  6. Follow the instructions in the Technology Tips Reference Page to share the document with "Anyone who has the Link".
  7. Upload the shared link to this assignment so that your instructor can see and edit your file.

If you have any problems, please let your instructor know.

assignment_name: Technology Tip - Create, Edit, and Share a short Video (Course objective 2)
description:
Submit

Technology Tip - Create, Edit, and Share a short Video (Course objective 2)

Technology Tip - Create, Edit, and Share a short Video

5 Points

Video presentations have become an important tool used by students, teachers and businesses as a flexible and effective way to present information, introduce one's self, and capture the attention of customers.  Tech 1010 includes several assignments that require the student to submit a video in place of a paper, so it is important to learn how to create, edit, and submit a video.

In this assignment you will learn how to create a video with your smartphone, edit it to add titles, and share it via the "cloud" using a web link (URL).

Instructions:

  1. Open the "Technology Tips - Reference Page" (click this link).
  2. In the section titled "Create a Video", follow the instructions for either Android or Apple iOS.
    Note: You may use any other method that you are aware of for creating a video as long as you are able to complete steps 3-6 below.
  3. Create a 30 second video of anything you wish.
  4. Edit the video to add a title with your name and "Tech 1010".  Have the title disappear (fade out) after a few seconds.
  5. Upload your video to a cloud platform (Google Photos, Google Drive, Apple iCloud, etc.) and share it via a web link (URL).
  6. Submit the web link (URL) to this assignment.
